extension.description: Switch between multiple Git profiles with one click. SSH keys and GPG signing sync automatically, and changes apply to submodules.
config.title: Git ID Switcher
config.identities: List of Git identities to switch between
config.identities.markdown:
List of Git profiles. Each identity can have:
- `id`: Unique ID (must not duplicate, required)
- `name`: Git user.name (required)
- `service`: Git hosting service (e.g., GitHub, GitLab)
- `email`: Git user.email (required)
- `icon`: Emoji to display in status bar (e.g., üè†, üíº)
- `description`: Note for this identity (e.g., Work, Personal)
- `sshKeyPath`: Path to SSH private key
- `sshHost`: SSH config host alias (for multi-account setups)
- `gpgKeyId`: GPG key ID for commit signing
config.identities.name: Git user.name (required)
config.identities.icon: Emoji to display in status bar (e.g., üè†, üíº)
config.identities.description: Note for this identity (e.g., Work, Personal)
config.identities.sshHost: SSH config host alias (for multi-account setups)
config.identities.gpgKeyId: GPG key ID for commit signing
config.defaultIdentity: Default identity ID to use when no identity is selected
config.autoSwitchSshKey: Automatically switch SSH key when changing identities
config.applyToSubmodules: Automatically apply identity to Git submodules when switching
config.includeIconInGitConfig: Include icon emoji in Git config user.name (affects commit history). When false, icon is only shown in the editor UI.
config.logging.fileEnabled: Save audit logs to file (records identity switches, SSH key operations, etc.)
config.logging.level: Log verbosity (DEBUG=all, ERROR=errors only). Records selected level and above.
config.logging.maxFileSize: Maximum file size in bytes before rotation (default: 10MB)
config.logging.maxFiles: Maximum number of rotated files to keep (default: 5)
config.logging.redactAllSensitive: When enabled, all values are masked in logs (maximum privacy)
config.commandTimeouts: Custom timeout values for commands (in milliseconds)
config.commandTimeouts.markdown:
Override default command timeouts. Example:
```json
{
  "git": 15000,
  "ssh-add": 10000
}
```
Default values: git=10000ms, ssh-add=5000ms, ssh-keygen=5000ms, others=30000ms
